{{ infobox person | name = Jean-Michel Carboni | image = Jean-Michel Carboni.jpg | caption = Jean-Michel Carboni, founder and CEO of ENGIE IT (2013) | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1955|7|23|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Nice]], [[France]] | nationality = [[France|French]] | alma_mater = [[MSc]] in Finance at [[ESCP Europe]] (1974-77). | occupation = - Founder and CEO of [[ENGIE IT]] (2012-15),<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lenouveleconomiste.fr/annonces-legales/consultation/annonce-legale-gdf-suez-information-et-technologies-17877.html|title=Annonce Légale - Le nouvel Economiste|publisher=}}</ref> revenue in 2013 : {{increase}}[[Euro|€]]600 million.
- Manager of DSI (IT department) between 2010-12 (€1,35 billion of revenue in 2012).
- Member of [[Engie]] Group Management Committee (Engie revenue : {{increase}}[[Euro|€]]66,6 billion in 2016).<ref>https://www.engie.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/engie-resultats-annuels-2015-presentation-et-annexes.pdf</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engie.com/investisseurs/chiffres-cles/|title=Chiffres clés ENGIE - résultats financiers - ENGIE|website=www.engie.com}}</ref> | relatives = }}
'''Jean-Michel Carboni''' (born on July 23 1955) is a French Chief Executive Officer, Senior Executive in the energy sector, of EDF-GDF, [[Gaz de France]] and [[Engie]] groups. He was in charge especially of Engie Italy (revenue: €1,4 billion), of the IT department (revenue: €1,35 billion) and the founder/CEO of [[ENGIE IT]] (revenue: €600 million).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lalettrea.fr/strategies-d-entreprise/2015/04/02/gdf-suez-tente-de-remettre-son-it-a-flot,108068105-ARL|title=GDF Suez tente de remettre son IT à flot - La Lettre A|date=2 April 2015|publisher=}}</ref> He was member of the top 20 of [[Engie]]'s management committee (2013).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lalettrea.fr/strategies-d-entreprise/2015/04/02/gdf-suez-tente-de-remettre-son-it-a-flot,108068105-ARL|title=GDF Suez tente de remettre son IT à flot|work=lalettrea.fr}}</ref>
==Early life== Son of [[Michel Carboni]], Central inspector and Collector manager of [[Nice]] customs. Carboni grew up in this town where he attended the Lycée Masséna. In 1977 he graduated from [[ESCP Europe]] business school in Paris.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.escpeuropealumni.org/gene/main.php?sizeup_=&referer2=%2Fwww.google.fr%2F&poste=1600x1000x24|title=ESCP Europe Alumni Association : Réseau, Actualités, Evolution Professionnelle, Annuaire, Solidarité|author=ESCP Europe Alumni|work=escpeuropealumni.org}}</ref>
==Career== <!--Per [[Wikipedia:Image#Location]] "Do not place images on the left at the start of any section or subsection"--> [[File:Jean-Michel Carboni - Engie Tower.jpg|thumb|Jean-Michel Carboni, senior executive of Engie group]] Carboni began his career in [[French diplomacy]] (1977) as Trade attaché at French Embassy of [[Athens]] ([[Greece]]), before joining in 1979 marketing department of [[Nestlé]] group. In 1980 he joined French public group EDF-GDF (EDF: [[Électricité de France]] and GDF: [[Gaz de France]], today [[Électricité de France|EDF]] and [[Engie]]) in SAPAR subsidiary as CFO of [[Creys-Mépieu|Creys-Malville]]'s Nuclear power plant. Then he joined EDF-GDF's Finance Department as Chief of the Treasury and of the Trading room (management of assets and debt : €15 billion).<ref name="efthia.net">{{cite web|url=http://efthia.net/|title=EFTHIA CONSULTING – Straight to the top results.|website=efthia.net}}</ref>
In 1997, Carboni took over as CEO of COFATHEC Italy (€300M, 3,000 employees), today ENGY [[:fr:Cofely|Cofely]] {{fr icon}} and between 2001-03 he is the Delegate General of the e-compagnie (in charge of new technologies, internet, intranet, e-purchasing). He came back in 2004 at EDF-GDF's Finance Department to manage the purchase of Romanian group DISTRIGAZ (€500M, 10,000 employees). Then he was appointed CFO of CNIEG (National Pension Fund of Electricity and Gas Industries) to restructure IEG pension fund (with €1 billion of financing).
Between 2005-07 he is CFO and General Manager of [[Gaz de France]]'s subsidiaries in Central Eastern Europe (Hungary, Romania, Czech republic, Poland, Slovakia): Égáz-Dégáz, Distrigaz, etc.
After the merger of [[Gaz de France]] and [[Suez]] in 2008, GDF Suez is born and Carboni became co-CEO of [[GDF Suez]] Italy (revenue 2009 : €1,4 billion and 2 millions of customers) with Luca Valerio Camerano (current CEO of Italian company [[A2A]]). This Business Unit gathers power plants, gas networks, storage centres and renewable energy.<ref name="efthia.net"/>
Between 2010-12 Carboni was in charge of the DSI : [[GDF Suez]]'s IT department (€1,35 billion in 2012) with the mission to pool IT services and to create [[ENGIE IT]] (at that time GDF Suez IT). In 2013, [[ENGIE IT]] was the major IT (Information & Technologies) subsidiary of European continent with a turnover of €600 million and 2,700 employees.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.societe.com/societe/engie-information-et-technologies-340793959.html|title=ENGIE INFORMATION ET TECHNOLOGIES (SAINT OUEN) Chiffre d'affaires, résultat, bilans sur SOCIETE.COM - 340793959|website=www.societe.com}}</ref> Jean-Michel Carboni is the CEO of [[ENGIE IT]] between 2012-15.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lalettrea.fr/strategies-d-entreprise/2015/04/02/gdf-suez-tente-de-remettre-son-it-a-flot,108068105-ARL|title=GDF Suez tente de remettre son IT à flot - La Lettre A|date=2 April 2015|publisher=}}</ref><ref>http://www.lalettrea.fr/strategies-d-entreprise/2015/10/01/l-it-d-engie-change-de-braquet,108094250-ARL</ref>
In 2016, Carboni is a special advisor of [[Engie]]'s CEO Isabelle Kocher.
In 2018, he is co-founder of a business and strategic consulting firm : Efthia Consulting.<ref name="efthia.net"/>
==Personal life== Father of 3 children, including [[Jérémie Carboni]], producer and political advisor.<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4425048/bio?ref_=nm_ov_bio_sm Jérémie Carboni IMDB Page with information on Jean-Michel Carboni]</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} '''Sir John Lionel Beckwith''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (born 19 March 1947)<ref name=Burkes>[http://www.burkespeerage.com/FamilyHomepage.aspx?FID=934 "Preview Family Record - Beckwith"], ''Burke's Peerage''. Retrieved 17 December 2012.</ref> is a [[England|British]] businessman.
==Early life== John Beckwith was born on 19 March 1947. He was educated at [[Harrow School]].<ref name=Burkes /> He is reportedly a "sport fanatic" and, as of 2011, had run four marathons.<ref name=TelegraphJan2011 /> He is the uncle of socialite [[Tamara Beckwith]].<ref name=TelegraphJan2011>Louise Armitstead, [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/banksandfinance/8256487/Sir-John-Beckwith-profile.html "Sir John Beckwith: profile"], ''The Telegraph'', 13 January 2011. Retrieved 18 December 2012.</ref>
==Career== Beckwith qualified as a [[Chartered Accountant]] with [[Arthur Andersen|Arthur Andersen & Co]]<ref name=LufbrDr>[http://www.lboro.ac.uk/service/publicity/degree_days/degree_2000/beckwith.html "Public Oration - John Beckwith"], ''Loughborough University'', 17 July 2000. Retrieved 17 December 2012.</ref> from 1969 to 1971. In 1971, together with his brother Peter, he established the London and Edinburgh Trust PLC which they soon made one of the [[United Kingdom]]'s top ten real estate companies.<ref name=LufbrDr /> Beckwith served as chairman until 1993.<ref name=LufbrDr /> In 1986, Beckwith founded Rutland Trust PLC, a diversified corporate finance, venture capital and insurance broking group, where he served as chairman until 1991.<ref name=LufbrDr /> In 1993, Beckwith founded the private investment company Pacific Investments PLC. In 2007, Rutland Trust PLC merged with August Equity Trust PLC to form New Star Private Equity Investment Trust PLC.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Rutland Partners announces final close on second fund at £322m|date=24 July 2007|publisher=Rutland Partners|url=http://www.rutlandpartners.com/announcement.html?id=3}}</ref>
==Philanthropy== It is ironic that Beckwith is Founder and President of [[Youth Sport Trust]],<ref>[http://www.youthsporttrust.org/about-us/our-board.aspx "Our Board"], ''Youth Sport Trust''. Retrieved 18 December 2012.</ref> an independent charity devoted to changing young people's lives through sport.<ref>[http://www.youthsporttrust.org/about-us.aspx "About Us"], ''Youth Sport Trust''. Retrieved 18 December 2012.</ref> He is a Vice President of the [[Royal National Institute of Blind People]].<ref>[http://www.rnib.org.uk/aboutus/who/governed/Pages/governance.aspx "How we are governed"], ''RNIB'', 6 August 2012. Retrieved 18 December 2012.</ref> He is a Patron of the [[Teenage Cancer Trust]]<ref>[http://www.teenagecancertrust.org/who-we-are/patrons/ "Patrons"], ''Teenage Cancer Trust''. Retrieved 18 December 2012.</ref> and was a member of the Development Board of the Cancer Relief Macmillan Fund (later [[Macmillan Cancer Support]]).<ref name=LufbrDr /> Beckwith established the Sir John Beckwith Charitable Trust in 1987 with the announced aim of helping a broad spectrum of charitable bodies.<ref name=PacInvPhil /> Between April 1993 and April 2010, the Trust made donations totalling £6.87m across a wide range of educational, sports, arts, medical and community organisations.<ref name=PacInvPhil>[http://www.pacificinvestments.com/philanthropy/ "Charity & CSR"], ''Pacific Investments''. Retrieved 19 December 2012.</ref>
==Honours== In 1996, Beckwith was made Commander of the [[Order of the British Empire]] (CBE), and in 2002 he was [[Knight Bachelor|knighted]] for his service to youth sports.<ref name="Queen's Honours">{{cite web|url=http://www.awardsintelligence.co.uk/blog/sporting-heroes-recognised-queens-honours-list|title=Sporting heroes recognised in Queen's Honours List|publisher=Awards Intelligence|date=2015|accessdate=27 July 2015}}</ref> In 2000 he was awarded an honorary [[Doctor of Letters]] degree (''Hon DLitt'') by [[Loughborough University]].<ref name=LufbrDr />
==References== {{Reflist}}

The '''Kiev Bank Union''' ({{lang-uk|Київський Банківський Союз|translit=Kyivskyi Bankivskyi Soyuz}}) is a [[banking]] association created in 1994 by twenty [[commercial bank]]s operating in the city of [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]], for the purpose of cooperation between Kiev's financial institutions, and to manage collective interaction with authorities. The Kiev Bank Union works with Committees of the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (the Ukrainian [[parliament]]); the [[National Bank of Ukraine]] (Ukraine's [[central bank]]); the Ukrainian Ministry of Justice, and the tax administration of Ukraine to discuss improvement of banking legislation and other relevant matters.
In 2005, the Kiev Bank Union represented about 70 Ukrainian and overseas financial credit establishments.
Prominent city banker and politician [[Leonid Chernovetsky]] is the founder and leader of the union.
== External links == *[http://www.kbs.org.ua/ Kiev Bank Union - official page]

'''Marta Yanci''' is a Dubai-based [[Spain|Spanish]] chef and the owner and founder of Marta's Kitchen,<ref>http://www.martaskitchen.com/</ref> a boutique Dubai catering company and Marta's Workshop, a culinary atelier restaurant.<ref>http://www.timeoutdubai.com/restaurants/details/15201-martas-workshop</ref><ref>http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g295424-d5040452-Reviews-Marta_s_Workshop-Dubai_Emirate_of_Dubai.html</ref> Born in [[San Sebastián]], Spain in 1980, Marta Yanci started her career in Law but shifted to the culinary world shortly after moving to Dubai.<ref>[https://picklemyfancy.wordpress.com/2016/02/15/chef-talk-fire-it-up-with-chef-marta-yanci/]</ref>
Less than one year after opening, Marta's Workshop won the Hidden Gem award of Dubai's Restaurant Buzz Food Awards.<ref>[http://ameinfo.com/luxury-lifestyle/leisure/fine-dining/restaurant-buzz-awards-crowns-eight-restaurant-winners/ Hidden Gem category of the Restaurant Food Buzz Awards]</ref>
In 2013, Chef Marta was hired by Spain's Canal Cocina food channel to produce a dedicated cooking show.<ref>[http://canalcocina.es/cocinero/marta-yanci TV show]</ref> Season 1 of the series, entitled "Recipes for Under 5 euros"<ref>https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEH_yOFhARUUHl88tFDl-Xt5hZ2l3e5J1</ref> brought 22 chapter adapted Chef Marta's creations adapted to constrained budgets.
Following the success of the first season, Chef Marta returned to Canal Cocina to launch the second season of her show.<ref>[http://sociedad.elpais.com/sociedad/2014/02/13/actualidad/1392332202_676643.html]</ref> Due to the success of her show and her business in Dubai,<ref>http://www.abc.es/viajar/restaurantes/20140123/abci-dubai-chef-espanola-201401231108.html</ref> Marta's story received a wide coverage across Spanish media<ref>http://ecoteuve.eleconomista.es/programas/noticias/5188441/10/13/Marta-Yanci-la-cocinera-espanola-que-ha-conquistado-Dubai-llega-a-CANAL-COCINA-con-Recetas-por-5-.html#.Kku8BuhWwtbWDpX</ref>
In 2011, she won the Dubai's Best Amateur Cook competition of the [[Studio One (Dubai One series)|''Studio One'' show of Dubai One TV]], judged by Chef Sameer Miglani of the Movenpick Hotel in [[Bur Dubai]]. After this award, Marta founded Marta's Kitchen,<ref>https://plus.google.com/b/102352307248734345345/102352307248734345345/posts</ref> offering private <ref>[http://www.thenational.ae/lifestyle/food/guess-whos-coming-to-dinner-host-evenings-with-a-difference chef services]</ref><ref>http://gulfnews.com/gntv/lifestyle/aquariuis-candelite-workshop-with-chef-marta-yanci-1.1114013</ref> at first and growing the business to larger capacities later on.
Through Marta's Kitchen, Marta Yanci has developed initiatives to use cooking and the culinary arts as a channel to bring people together and.<ref>[http://www.thenational.ae/lifestyle/food/uae-cooking-classes-if-you-cant-stand-the-heat-get-into-the-kitchen learn about food]</ref>
Marta is an advocate of <ref>[http://mycustardpie.com/2013/06/01/review-food-drink-restaurants-wine-dubai/12tavola/ women's health issues]</ref> and a regular contributor to Dubai's <ref>[http://www.hoteliermiddleeast.com/14103-martas-kitchen-spearheads-new-culinary-forum/#.UesANY1HKrk food magazines]</ref> and online portals. Her cooking philosophy is to maximize taste and texture. She is married and has two children.
==References== {{Reflist|2}}

'''Paul Matthyssens''' (born 1955<ref name="hln.be 2013">"[http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/1265/Onderwijs/article/detail/1514946/2012/10/11/Paul-Matthyssens-nieuwe-decaan-van-Antwerp-Management-School.dhtml Paul Matthyssens nieuwe decaan van Antwerp Management School]" at ''hln.be''. 11/10/12</ref>) is a Belgian [[organizational theorist]], management consultant, and Professor in Strategic Management and Global Strategic Management at the [[University of Antwerp]], Department of Management, and at the [[Antwerp Management School]].<ref name="UA 2013">[http://www.ua.ac.be/main.aspx?c=paul.matthyssens Paul Matthyssens : Achtergrond] at ua.ac.be. Accessed 7 October 2013.</ref> known for his work of service-oriented strategy.<ref>Mathieu, Valérie. "Service strategies within the manufacturing sector: benefits, costs and partnership." International Journal of Service Industry Management 12.5 (2001): 451-475.</ref><ref>Windahl, Charlotta, and Nicolette Lakemond. "Developing integrated solutions: the importance of relationships within the network." Industrial Marketing Management 35.7 (2006): 806-818.</ref>
== Biography == Born in [[Wilrijk]], Matthyssens in 1980 received his PhD in marketing (special licence) from [[Ghent University]] with a thesis entitled "Marktbewerking voor industriële produkten." (Marketing of industrial products).<ref>RUG (1980) ''RUG. Lijst der geslaagden, proefschriften.'' p. 319</ref>
Matthyssens started his academic career in 1982 as faculty member of the [[Antwerp Management School]] of the [[University of Antwerp]]. He is appointed Professor of strategic management and global strategic management, and chaired the Department of Management of the University of Antwerp from 2007 to 2013, and is since September 2013 Dean of the [[Antwerp Management School]] as successor of [[Philippe Naert]].<ref name="hln.be 2013"/> Among his PhD students is [[Koen Vandenbempt]] (PhD 1999).
From 1994 to 2008 he was also Professor of Business-to-Business Marketing at the [[Erasmus University Rotterdam]]. He has also been Visiting professor at the [[Copenhagen Business School]], and at the [[Stockholm School of Economics]], and lectured at numerous other universities.<ref name="UA 2013"/>
== Work == Matthyssens' research interests focuses on "strategic buyer-supplier relations, value creation strategies, market strategy and strategic innovation in international and business-to-business markets."<ref name="UA 2013"/>
== Publications == Matthyssens has authored and co-authored numerous books and articles.<ref>[http://opc4.kb.nl/DB=1/SET=2/TTL=1/CLK?IKT=1004&TRM=matthyssens,paul Matthyssens, Paul] List of publications at National Library of the Netherlands.</ref> Books, a selection: * 1998. ''Concurrentiestrategie en marktdynamiek : op weg naar concurrentievoordeel in industriële markten''. Paul Matthyssens, [[Rudy Martens]], [[Koen Vandenbempt]]. Deventer : Kluwer BedrijfsInformatie * 2000. ''Marketingcommunicatie in zakelijke markten : strategische en geïntegreerde communicatie voor business-to-business-marketeers.'' [[Marc Logman]], Paul Matthyssens, W. Fred van Raaij. Alphen aan den Rijn : Samsom * 2002. ''Stakeholder Synergie : vijfentwintigste Vlaams wetenschappelijk economisch congres, Hasselt, 14 maart 2002.'' Ludo Peeters, Paul Matthyssens en Lode Vereeck (eds.) Leuven ; Apeldoorn : Garant * 2004. ''Waardecreatie en innovatie in de industrie : nieuwe denkkaders versus oude gewoonten''. Paul Matthyssens, [[Koen Vandenbempt]], Liselore Berghman. Leuven : Acco
Articles, a selection: * Matthyssens, Paul, and Christophe Van den Bulte. "Getting closer and nicer: partnerships in the supply chain." Long Range Planning 27.1 (1994): 72-83. * Matthyssens, Paul, and [[Koen Vandenbempt]]. "Creating competitive advantage in industrial services." Journal of Business & Industrial Marketing 13.4/5 (1998): 339-355. * Axinn, Catherine N., and Paul Matthyssens. "Limits of internationalization theories in an unlimited world." International marketing review 19.5 (2002): 436-449. * Aerts, Kris, Paul Matthyssens, and [[Koen Vandenbempt]]. "[https://lirias.kuleuven.be/bitstream/123456789/122694/1/0560.pdf Critical role and screening practices of European business incubators]." Technovation 27.5 (2007): 254-267. * Matthyssens, Paul, and Koen Vandenbempt. "Moving from basic offerings to value-added solutions: strategies, barriers and alignment." Industrial Marketing Management 37.3 (2008): 316-328.
== References == {{reflist|2}}
== External links == * {{nl}} [http://commanity.files.wordpress.com/2011/10/cxo_97_mag_paulmat_201110.pdf “Business na de crisis? – Van product naar total care”], Paul Matthyssens, ''CxO Magazine'', 11/2011
{{Authority control}}

{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Portuguese Securities Market Commission |nativename = Comissão do Mercado de Valores Mobiliários |logo = Seal of the Comissão do Mercado de Valores Mobiliários.jpg |logo_width = 150px |logo_caption = |seal = |seal_width = |seal_caption = |formed = 10 May 1991 |preceding1 = |dissolved = |superseding = |jurisdiction = [[Portugal]] |headquarters = Rua Laura Alves, n.º 4 - Apartado 14258 - Lisbon |employees = |chief1_name = Gabriela Figueiredo Dias |chief1_position = Chair of the Management Board |website = http://www.cmvm.pt/ |footnotes = |budget=|chief2_name=|chief2_position=|chief3_name=|chief3_position=|chief4_name=|chief4_position=|chief5_name=|chief5_position=|chief6_name=|chief6_position=|chief7_name=|chief7_position=|chief8_name=|chief8_position=|chief9_name=|chief9_position=|parent_department=|keydocument1=[https://dre.pt/application/file/a/322402 Decree-Law No. 142-A/91, of 10 April (inception of CMVM in portuguese)]|agency_type=Legal entity governed by public law}} The '''Portuguese Securities Market Commission''', also known by its initials as "CMVM", was incepted via Decree-Law No. 142-A/91, of 10 April, and established on 10 May 1991 following 30 days after its publication. It supervises and regulates securities and other financial instruments and activities of all those who operate within said markets. It is also CMVM’s mission to:
* Sanction infractions to the Securities Code and other national legislation; * Ensure the stability of the financial markets, by contributing to identify and prevent systemic risk; * Contribute to the development of financial instruments markets; * Provide information and handle complaints of non-qualified investors; * Mediate conflicts between entities that are subject to its supervision and between said and individual investors; * Assist the Government and the Finance Minister; * Perform any other tasks that may be assigned by law.
The CMVM is an independent public institution endowed with administrative and financial autonomy. It derives its income from supervision fees charged for services and not the General State Budget.
CMVM structure:
* Management Board * Supervisory Board; * Advisory Board; * Ethics Committee
The CMVM integrates the European System of Financial Supervision and the National Council of Financial Supervisors.

revision.text:
{{Infobox book | name = Progress: Ten Reasons to Look Forward to the Future | title_orig = | translator = | image = Progress Ten Reasons to Look Forward to the Future.jpg | caption = | author = [[Johan Norberg]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = | language =English | series = | subject = [[Globalization]], [[Social progress|progress]] | genre = | publisher = [[Oneworld Publications]] | release_date = Sep 2016 | english_release_date = | media_type = Print (hardcover & paperback) | pages = 304 | isbn = 978-1-78074-950-1 | isbn_note = (hardcover) | dewey= | congress= | oclc= 958121231 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }}
'''''Progress: Ten Reasons to Look Forward to the Future''''' is a 2016 book by [[Sweden|Swedish]] writer [[Johan Norberg]] (a Senior Fellow of the libertarian [[Cato Institute]]), which promotes [[globalization]], [[free trade]] and the notion of [[Social progress|progress]]. In it, Norberg develops his ideas published previously in ''[[In Defense of Global Capitalism]]'' (2001).<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://reason.com/archives/2016/09/13/looking-forward-to-the-future|title=Looking Forward to the Future|date=2016-09-13|newspaper=Reason.com|access-date=2016-10-19}}</ref>
==Contents== The book is composed of ten chapters which discuss progress in various spheres of life, including "food, sanitation, life expectancy, poverty, violence, the environment, literacy, freedom, equality, the conditions of childhood".<ref name=kirkus/> Norberg argues that today humanity has reached its highest ever (so far) levels of [[living standards]].<ref name=kirkus/> The author notes that in all areas of our lives, people are, on average, healthier and wealthier than in the past.<ref name=kirkus/> For example, global [[literacy]] improved from about 20% to about 85% by the end of the century, and global [[average life expectancy]] has increased from 31 years in 1900 to 71 by the early 21st century.<ref name=kirkus/> People are more intelligent (the [[Flynn effect]]).<ref name=economist/> Access to modern sanitation tripled over the last thirty years.<ref name=economist/> [[Famine]] went from being a universal phenomenon to being an exception affecting only a small fraction of the world.<ref name=thetimes/> Global violence, whether [[homicide]] or war casualties, is in decline.<ref name=economist/> He also notes that most people tend be preoccupied with bad news, such as [[terrorism]], which is however much less common than in the past (just reported much more widely thanks to modern media).<ref name=kirkus/><ref name=economist/>
The book's spirit is summed up by the author, who writes in an article about the book, "we’re living in a [[Golden age (metaphor)|golden age]]".<ref>{{Cite news|author=Johan Norberg|url=http://www.spectator.co.uk/2016/08/why-cant-we-see-that-were-living-in-a-golden-age/|title=Why can’t we see that we’re living in a golden age?|date=2016-08-20|newspaper=The Spectator|language=en-US|access-date=2016-10-11}}</ref>
==Reviews== The book received positive reviews from ''[[The Economist]]'', ''[[The Times]]'' and ''[[Kirkus Reviews]]''.<ref name=kirkus>{{Cite book|url=https://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/johan-norberg/progress/|title=PROGRESS by Johan Norberg {{!}} Kirkus Reviews|language=en-us}}</ref><ref name=economist>{{Cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/news/books-and-arts/21706231-human-life-has-improved-many-ways-both-recently-according-swedish-economic|title=Better and better|date=2016-09-03|newspaper=The Economist|issn=0013-0613|access-date=2016-10-11}}</ref><ref name=thetimes>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/progress-ten-reasons-to-look-forward-to-the-future-by-johan-norberg-3t2kxf67c|title=Progress: Ten Reasons to Look Forward to the Future by Johan Norberg|access-date=2016-10-11}}</ref> Robbie Millen writing for ''The Times'' concludes that "Norberg has a strong case and he makes it with energy and charm".<ref name=thetimes/> ''The Economist''{{'}}s review ends with "This book is a blast of good sense",<ref name=economist/> while the ''Kirkus Reviews'' piece about the book describes it as "brightly written, upbeat... refreshingly rosy assessment of how far many of us have come from the days when life was uniformly nasty, brutish, and short".<ref name=kirkus/>
==See also== *[[Idea of Progress]] *''[[The Moral Arc]]'' *''[[The Better Angels of Our Nature]]'' *''[[The Rational Optimist]]''
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *{{Cite news|author=Johan Norberg|url=http://www.spectator.co.uk/2016/08/why-cant-we-see-that-were-living-in-a-golden-age/|title=Why can’t we see that we’re living in a golden age?|date=2016-08-20|newspaper=The Spectator|language=en-US|access-date=2016-10-11}} * [https://www.cato.org/events/progress-ten-reasons-look-forward-future Cato Event] of October 12, 2016, in which Norberg discusses the book.

'''Rudi Mariën''' is a [[Belgium|Belgian]] scientist and businessman. He is [[Chairman]] of the Belgian biotech company [[Innogenetics]].
==Education== Rudi Mariën obtained a degree in pharmaceutical sciences from the [[University of Ghent]], specializing in [[Clinical chemistry|clinical biology]].
==Career== On 18 July 1985, he co-founded the Belgian biotech company Innogenetics, together with [[Erik Tambuyzer]] and [[Hugo Van Heuverswyn]] and has been its Chairman since then. Besides Innogenetics, he founded several clinical laboratories. He is at present managing director of BARC NV, an international centralized clinical laboratory. He is also CEO of Gengest BVBA (management company), Biovest CVA, LMA BVBA, Laboraco BVBA, and he is director of DSJ Bruxelles NV and Oystershell NV. Rudi Mariën is a member of the [[American Association for Clinical Chemistry]].

[[File:Felice Beato (British, born Italy - (Portrait of Colonel Abbott, Inspector General of Ordnance) - Google Art Project.jpg|thumb|Photograph by [[Felice Beato]], 1858–1859]] [[Major-General]] '''Saunders Alexius Abbott''' (9 July 1811 – 7 February 1894) was an army officer in the [[British East India Company]].
==Family background== Saunders was the fourth son of Henry Alexius Abbott, a retired [[Calcutta]] merchant of Blackheath, Kent,<ref>Biog. Of Henry Alexius Abbot per the obituaries of his prominent sons</ref> and his wife Margaret Welsh, the daughter of William Welsh of Edinburgh. He had the following siblings:
* Margaret (1801–1877) * Major General [[Augustus Abbott]] CB (1804–1867) * Major General Sir [[Frederick Abbott (Indian Army officer)|Frederick Abbott]] CB (1805–1892) * General Sir [[James Abbott (Indian Army officer)|James Abbott]] KCB (1807–1896) * Emma Abbott (1809–1875) * [[Keith Edward Abbott]], Consul General (1814–1873) * Edmund Abbott (1816–1816)
==Career== Abbott was educated privately and (like his brothers Augustus and Frederick) at [[Addiscombe Military Seminary]]. In 1828, he joined the [[Bengal Infantry]]. He was appointed in 1836 to be Assistant in the Revenue Survey under [[Henry Montgomery Lawrence]]. Abbott held Survey charges from 1838 to 1842. Abbott fought in the [[First Anglo-Sikh War]]. At the [[Battle of Mudki]], he forced marched reserves from [[Kasauli]] and [[Sabathu]]. He served later as [[aide-de-camp]] to Sir [[Henry Hardinge]] at the [[Battle of Ferozeshah]], during which he was dangerously wounded. In 1846 he was a [[Brevet (military)|brevet]]-[[Major-general|major]].
Abbott was appointed Deputy Commissioner of [[Umbala]] in 1847. He was appointed to the same post in [[Hoshiarpur]] in 1849 and held the post during a mutiny. From 1858 to 1863 he was Commissioner of [[Lucknow]]. He was an honorary aide-de-camp to the [[Governor-general of India|governors-general]] until his retirement in September 1864.
After his retirement, Abbott became an agent for a railway company in [[Lahore]] before being promoted to its board of directors. He died in [[Brighton]] on 7 February 1894.
==Sources== *{{cite book|first=Buckland|last=C.|year=1906|title=''Dictionary of Indian Biography''| editor = Charles Edward Buckland| pages= 2| publisher=Swan Sonnenschein & Co., Lim: London|location=Harvard University, Digitized 8 July 2005|id=| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=InFTmnS4crYC&printsec=frontcover&dq=dictionary+biography&as_brr=2&ie=ISO-8859-1| authorlink=}} *{{Cite encyclopedia|first=R.H. |last=Vetch |first2=Roger T. (reviewer) |last2=Stearn |title=Saunders Alexius Abbott (1811–1894) ''in'' Abbott, Augustus (1804–1867) |encyclopedia=Oxford Dictionary of National Biography |publisher=Oxford University Press |origyear=2004 |year=2010 |edition=online |doi=10.1093/ref:odnb/11 }} {{subscription}}

'''SimulTrain''' is a [[Project Management Simulator]] used in [[project management]] training programs. SimulTrain is a simulation of the planning and execution phases of a medium-sized [[project]], that involves all of the events that occur.<ref>[http://www.slideshare.net/igorkokcharov/what-is-project-management-27448701 What Is Project Management?]</ref> SimulTrain is a computer-based multimedia tool which allows the participants to learn: * to structure a project; * to control the progress of a project; * to use project management tools.
==Overview==
[[Image: RACIQ_Chart_-_Responsibility_Assignment_Matrix.jpg |thumb| RACI Chart.<ref>[http://www.slideshare.net/igorkokcharov/responsibility-assignment-matrix-raci-chart-explained What Is Responsibility Assignment Matrix RACI?]</ref>]]
The first version of SimulTrain was released in 1996. This [[educational software]] has been constantly improved. The recent version includes an expert system that analyses the managers' behaviour and provides them with detailed feedback.<ref>Kokcharov I. Using Business Simulation to Analyse Project Management Decision Making. Proceedings of 45th Conference of the International Simulation and Gaming Association. Dornbirn, Austria, 2014, page 213 - 318 http://www.slideshare.net/igorkokcharov/using-business-simulation-to-analyse-project-management-decision-making</ref> In September 2015 the 11th version of SimulTrain was released. It includes Resource Leveling exercise, RACI Matrix, and Risk Register.
[[File: SimulTrain12RiskRegister.JPG|thumb| The example of the Risk Register for a project that includes 4 steps: Identify, Analyze, Plan Response, Monitor and Control.<ref>[http://www.slideshare.net/igorkokcharov/what-is-project-risk-management What Is Risk Management?]</ref>]]
The project management simulation SimulTrain is based on Dr. Roland Sauter‘s PhD thesis ''La modélisation des facteurs humains dans la gestion de projets. (1996)''. A model of human factors in project management was validated by a survey of 900 project managers. In 1996 the simulator was developed based on this model.
The first version ran on Macintosh. Since then a new version with numerous new features was released regularly every two years. Version 9 released in October 2012 runs on various operating systems (Windows, Macintosh, Linux) and is available both as online version and desktop version.
By 2015 over 150,000 people across 50 countries, have been trained with SimulTrain. The simulation has been translated into 22 languages.
Resource Leveling exercise is a new feature added in 2013. This is an example of Resource leveling for a mid-size project.<ref>SimulTrain Resource Leveling https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xcOD_ViGJYg</ref> The chart shows the number of people involved in a project and its change with time. [[File:SimulTrainResourceLeveling.jpg|thumb|Resource Leveling optimizes histogram of resources usage on a project.]]
==Pedagogic concept==
Training is done in small groups of 4 people in two sessions of 3–4 hours each. Each group has one computer with the simulation program. The participants thus learn how to work and make decisions as a team. The simulator allows the group to work on the progress and execution of the project. It confronts the learners with many situations requiring the ability of making fast decisions and of taking all of the project parameters into account (costs, deadlines as well as human factors). The feedback and consequences of the different decisions are immediately made visible. The simulator involves multimedia technology: the participants receive many phone calls, e-mails and voice-mails, thus immersing them in surrounding them in a realistic project atmosphere.
The trainees have to complete the project within the deadline and budget. Their main tasks as project managers include: * setting up the project team, hiring employees with the proper qualifications at the right time * showing team members their tasks * making adequate decisions when facing difficulties, overrunning the budget or failing to meet the deadline * maintaining a good team dynamic
With the simulation attendees learn in two ways: * from the reactions of the people involved in the project to the decisions made. (Feedback). * from the potent interactions that develop in the four-person groups as each person plays a very precise role (such as supervising the schedule, costs, quality, and motivation).
SimulTrain's only requirement is a general knowledge about project management, including the [[Gantt chart]] and the Activity Network. Both online and desktop versions of the simulator are available.
[[File:projectmanagersdo.jpg|center|The simulator trains project managers to do their work effectively]]
==Scenarios==
===IT service deployment project===
In accordance with the marketing strategy defined at the beginning of the year, the management wishes to provide its customers with an on-line interactive service. This will allow customers to follow up and control orders without the intervention of either the customer service or accounting departments. For this project a tentative schedule has been written with the list of activities, budget and time required. The core-team has been established.
===Production project===
Plastoceram is the leading firm in manufacturing special packages made of composite materials. One of its clients that produces pacemakers cannot find any appropriate solution for the case of its latest ultra-miniature model. A case thus needs to be developed for this client within a very short time. It should be made of a resistant, very thin and easy-to-fashion material.
===Marketing project===
Your company has devised a new all-in-one Smartphone. This high performance appliance includes many innovative features, which makes it very attractive for listeners on the go and consumers who enjoy new technologies. The product conception is almost finished and its launch on the market must now be prepared. For this project tentative specifications have been written with the list of activities, budget and time required. The core-team has been established.
===Organizing a sport event===
The International Lausanne Football Tournament will gather some of the most important European youth football clubs. The National Federation is organizing the event for the first time. An organization specialized in sport events allocates all its resources to the event. The project "ILFT phase B" is a part of the preparation process. The preparation must be finished 2 weeks before the opening day. The core team and budget have been established. Other resources of the Federation are available for the project.
===Agile hybrid software development===
The management wishes to provide our customers with an online interactive service. This will allow customers to follow-up and control orders without the intervention of either the customer service or accounting departments. The customer representative is the Product owner. List of product backlog tasks, budget and time required have been defined. The scenario includes elements of waterfall planning and flexibility of the agile software development.
===Portfolio Management Simulation===
[[File: Net_Present_Value_vs_Payback_time_Portfolio_Management_Simulation.jpg|thumb| The example of the Net Present Value vs Payback Time and Strategic Value for a portfolio of projects.]]
SimulTrain®+ <ref>[https://www.slideshare.net/igorkokcharov/what-is-project-portfolio-management What Is Project Portfolio Management?]</ref> is an extension of the project management simulation to Project Portfolio Management. With the serious game the trainees acquire such skills as prioritizing / balancing a portfolio of projects under resources, funding scarcity. The trainee use such key indicators as Strategic Value, Strategic Objectives, Net Present Value, Payback time, workload, risk, cash credit, and others.
[[File:Project Portfolio Roadmap Example.jpg|thumb|The project portfolio roadmap details links of the planned components, their contribution to the strategic goals of organization.]]
==References== {{Reflist}} * Roland Sauter. La modélisation des facteurs humains dans la gestion de projects. Thèse # 1494 (1996) EPFL, Lausanne. * Design and Production of Multimedia and Simulation-based Learning Material (1994) Kluwer. {{ISBN|0-7923-3020-X}}. * Karen Mantyla. Interactive Distance Learning Exercises that really Work! (1999) ASTD. {{ISBN|1-56286-128-X}}. * [https://books.google.com/books?id=OulStDyNh88C&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_summary_r&cad=0 Proceedings of the European Conference on Games-based Learning.] (2007) Academic Conferences Limited, 115. {{ISBN|1-905305-63-X}}.
==External links==
The free demo version can be found at [https://www.simultrain.swiss/ Project Management Simulation SimulTrain®] The free demo version can be found at [https://www.simultrain.swiss/plus/ Portfolio Management Simulation SimulTrain®+]
==See also== * [[Project management]] * [[Project Management Simulator]] * [[Project manager]] * [[Serious game]] a software application developed with game technology and game design principles for a primary purpose other than pure entertainment. * [[Simulation game]] * [[Simulation]] * [[Case study]]

{{short description|Minimum requirements for a recreational diver to dive in open water under direct supervision }} '''Supervised diver''' specifies the and certification for recreational scuba divers in international standard ISO 24801-1 <ref name=" ISO24801-1">{{cite web |url=https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:std:iso:24801:-1:ed-2:v1:en|title=Recreational diving services — Requirements for the training of recreational scuba divers — Part 1: Level 1 — Supervised diver (ISO 24801-1) |publisher=[[International Standards Organisation|ISO]] |access-date=2017-06-13}}</ref> and the equivalent European Standard EN 14153-1. Various diving organizations offer diving training that meets the requirements of the Supervised Diver. A diving certification which corresponds to the Supervised Diver allows for recreational diving under the direct supervision of a [[divemaster]] or recreational [[diving instructor]] in open water. Most diving organizations recommend not to exceed a diving depth of 10 to 12 metres . After the successful completion of a training equivalent to the Supervised diver, training can be extended to the [[Autonomous diver]] certification level (according to ISO 24801-2).
[[File:Scuba_education_levels.svg|thumb|upright=2.2|Scuba diving education levels as used by ISO, PADI, CMAS, SSI and NAUI]] Before initial diver training and thereafter at regular intervals, a diver should undergo a [[fitness to dive]] examination by a diving doctor. In some countries, such an examination is required by law and is a prerequisite for any training in many diving schools.
In some parts of the world there is minimum requirement which corresponds to the Autonomous Diver certification and an in-date medical certificate for hiring diving equipment and taking part in recreational diving. In these places a certificate which only corresponds to the Supervised Diver is regarded as insufficient.
==Scope of the standard== International standard ISO 24801-1 includes:<ref name=" ISO24801-1" /> *Prerequisites for training, including age and health requirements, *Required theoretical knowledge regarding scuba and basic diving equipment, the basic physics of diving, medical problems related to diving, the diving environment, scuba diver separation procedure, and the use of nitrox breathing gases, *Required scuba skills in confined and open water, *Practical training parameters, *Evaluation of knowledge and practical skills.
==Training according to ISO 24801-1== Every year around 1.7 million people are trained according to ISO 24801.<ref name="Statistics">945 000 annual certification by PADI {{cite web | url=http://www.padi.com/scuba/uploadedFiles/Scuba_--Do_not_use_this_folder_at_al/About_PADI/PADI_Statistics/2012%20WW%20Statistics.pdf | title=Worldwide Corporate Statistics 2013 - Data for 2007-2012 | publisher=PADI| date=February 2013 | access-date=2013-11-01| format=PDF|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102033307/http://www.padi.com/scuba/uploadedFiles/Scuba_--Do_not_use_this_folder_at_al/About_PADI/PADI_Statistics/2012%20WW%20Statistics.pdf | archive-date=2013-11-02 }} with market share of 56%, {{cite web | url=http://www.divebuddy.com/blog/11295/2013-market-share-scuba-certification-agencies-padi-naui-ssi/ | title=2013 Market Share of Scuba Certification Agencies (PADI, NAUI, SSI) | publisher=DiveBuddy.com | date=2013-07-25 |author=Greg | access-date=2013-11-01}} gives a total of about 1.7 million.</ref> Despite the standardization, the dive courses of individual diving organizations differ considerably in their content, expansion and philosophy. However, the minimum requirements defined in the ISO standard guarantee that a diver can easily convert between training organizations.
The following certifications meet the requirements for Supervised Diver:
===CMAS=== [[Confédération Mondiale des Activités Subaquatiques]] (CMAS) itself does not offer any training which corresponds to the Supervised Diver.<ref name="cmas-map">{{cite web | url=http://www.cmas.org/sitemap/training-map | title=Training Map |publisher=[[Confédération Mondiale des Activités Subaquatiques|CMAS]] International | access-date=2014-03-17 }}</ref> However, there are some CMAS affiliates (e.g. VDST or IAC ) that offer such training and certification independently of CMAS. It is usually called Basic Diver or similar. However, the content, regulations and designations of the individual CMAS member organizations can vary considerably.
===NAUI Passport Diver===
The NAUI Passport Diver (PD) is not a diving certification, it is only an entry level experience opportunity for interested amateurs to try out recreational diving. In this course, all the contents required by the standard for the Supervised Diver are taught.<ref name="NAUI-ISO">{{cite web |url=http://www.easydivers.ch/ueber_uns/zertifikat_iso_naui.pdf |title=Certificate | work=Nr. EUF - CB 2007 004 |publisher=European Underwater Federation (EUF) |access-date=2013-12-02 |format=PDF |language=de}}</ref> The Passport Diver training includes two guided dives in limited open water, with a previous theoretical introduction. The Passport Diver experience does not include certification, but can be counted towards a NAUI Scuba Diver course (SD) within six months. The Passport Diver experience does not require prior experience of diving, but normal physical health and fitness are required. Persons who wish to participate in a Passport Diver offer must be at least 12 years old, but a NAUI Junior Passport Diver can be done at the age of eight.<ref name="NAUI-PD">{{cite web | url=http://www.meintauchplatz.de/naui/passport-diver/ | title=Tauchkurs NAUI Passport Diver | author=Markus vom Scheidt | publisher=meintauchplatz.de | access-date=2014-03-17 | language=de | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130223063535/http://meintauchplatz.de/naui/passport-diver/ | archivedate=2013-02-23 | df= }}</ref> The experience for children differs only by a child-oriented presentation of the same contents.
===PADI Scuba Diver=== [[File:PADI-Ausbildungssystem.svg|thumb|upright=2.4|Overview of the PADI training system]] PADI Scuba Diver (SD) is a basic diver training course where a diver can learn all the content required in the ISO standard for a Supervised Diver. PADI allows SD divers to dive to a depth of 12 meters, accompanied by a PADI [[Divemaster]] or [[Diving instructor|Instructor]] .
The PADI Scuba Diver course includes the first three lessons of the five-part [[Open Water Diver]] course (OWD). Due to the modular design, Open Water Diver training can be divided into two courses, of which the first is PADI Scuba Diver. The SD course includes three theory and three swimming pool lessons, and at least two dives in open water with the scuba. PADI follows the "dive today" philosophy - after a theory lesson, dives usually take place on the same day. The pool dives - which can also take place in calm, current free, shallow open water, provide the training in the basic and emergency skills, including getting into the water, breathing under water using the regulator, use of fins, basic buoyancy control, mask clearing and regulator recovery.<ref name="OWD-Exler">{{cite web | url=http://www.exler.de/owdg.htm | title=PADI Open Water Diver Theorie}}, Wolfgang Exler</ref> The same exercises are partly repeated in the open water dives.
PADI-SD training can be started without prior experience of diving. Normal physical health and fitness are required. Persons who wish to attend an SD course must be at least 15 years old, but a PADI Junior SD course (JSD) can be attended at the age of 10 years. The children's dive course differs only in a child-oriented mediation of the same contents.
===SSI Scuba Diver=== The SSI Scuba Diver (SD) is a basic diver certification equivalent to the Supervised Diver standard. The training shall include at least two open water dives, which may only be carried out after the successful completion of the theoretical training. SSI allows SD divers, accompanied by a [[Divemaster|dive guide]] or instructor, to dive to a maximum depth of 12 meters.<ref name="SSI-Standards">{{cite web | url=http://www.divessi.com/d/SSI%20Global%20Training%20Standards/2014%20Global%20Training%20Standards%20GERMAN%20(Version%20v102013).ssp | title=2014 Training & Dive Center Standards | work=Scuba Schools International / v102813 | publisher=Concept Systems International GmbH | page=REC-8 | date=2013-10-28 | access-date=2014-02-25 }}{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> After successful completion, training can be continued with Open Water Diver Training (OWD). The SSI SD course does not require previous experience of diving. Normal physical health and fitness are required and an SSI Medical Statement is issued. The learner must be able to swim 180 meters without an aid. Persons who wish to attend an SD course must be at least 15 years old, but SSI Junior SD training can be done at the age of 10 years.<ref name="SSI-Standards" /> The children's dive course differs only in a child-oriented mediation of the same contents.
===Other training agencies=== Some diving organizations dispense with a training level corresponding to the Supervised Diver and define the contents of the Autonomous Diver according to (ISO 24801-2) as the lowest level of training and breeding. In addition to the above, the following training corresponds to the Supervised Diver according to ISO 24801-1:<ref name="Certified">{{cite web |url=https://certificates.austrian-standards.at/EUF_training_systems?5 |title=EUF Certified Training Systems/Training Organisations |publisher=European Underwater Federation (EUF) |access-date=2017-04-21}}</ref>

{{Infobox person |name = '''Thomas Neir''' |image = |birth_date = 2 September |birth_place = [[Kirkland, Washington]], United States |death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> |death_place = |other_names = |known_for = |occupation = CEO, '''TorrX, Inc'''. (TorrX.com),a Kirkland Councilmember,and a Partner in Cow Hollow Associates, LLC<ref name=CHabout>[http://www.cowhollowassociates.com/about/people/ Cow Hollow About page]</ref> Former [[Chief Executive Officer]] and founder of, [[Pacific Coffee Company]] (until May 2005) |alma_mater = [[University of Washington]] and the [[Darden Graduate School of Business Administration]], [[University of Virginia]] |spouse = |children = 2 }} [[File:HK Kln Bay Telford Plaza Pacific Coffee Company a.jpg|thumb|A [[Pacific Coffee Company]] store in [[Telford Plaza]], [[Hong Kong]].]]
'''Thomas Neir''' is currently CEO of TorrX, Inc. and a partner in Cow Hollow Associates, LLC<ref name=CHA>[http://www.cowhollowassociates.com Cow Hollow Associates]</ref> He also founded and was the [[Chief Executive Officer]] of the [[Pacific Coffee Company]] from the time of the company's founding until May 2005.<ref name=chevalier>[http://www.chevalier.com/english/files/inv_inf/citl/2005/a_8_apr_2005.pdf Chevalier sale agreement] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061019235719/http://www.chevalier.com/english/files/inv_inf/citl/2005/a_8_apr_2005.pdf |date=2006-10-19 }}</ref> Neir had also been a hi-tech company executive and senior [[financial analyst]].<ref name=darden>[http://www.darden.edu/uploadedFiles/Features/Showcase_Ad_Campaign/shc_Neir%5B1%5D.pdf Neir biography at Darden] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071006054718/http://www.darden.edu/uploadedFiles/Features/Showcase_Ad_Campaign/shc_Neir%5B1%5D.pdf |date=2007-10-06 }}</ref>
==Personal== Neir is married with two sons.<ref name="darden"/>
In 2012 Thomas Neir was on the board of [[Seattle Tilth]] from 2012 to 2017, and was appointed to [[Kirkland, Washington]]'s Transportation Commission in 2009, termed out after role as Chairman.
==Educational background== In 1979, he graduated with a [[Bachelor of Arts]] in [[Economics]] from the [[University of Washington]]. In 1988, he received an [[MBA]] from the [[Darden Graduate School of Business Administration]], [[University of Virginia]].<ref name=darden />
==Working experience== Since 1988, Neir had worked for a [[California]]-based hi-tech company, Tandem Computers, as senior [[financial analyst]] and [[marketing]] [[industry analyst|analyst]]. In late 1990, Neir was transferred to [[Hong Kong]] as area finance manager.<ref name=darden />
==Foundation of the Pacific Coffee Company== In [[Hong Kong]], Neir discovered that there was a lack of European-style coffee houses. He set up the Pacific Coffee Company, targeted at top business persons and senior executive-level customers in Hong Kong. The first retail outlet was located in the [[Bank of America Tower (Hong Kong)|Bank of America Tower]], [[Central, Hong Kong]].
The number of [[Pacific Coffee Company]] stores and outlets is over 135 in Hong Kong and over 400 locations in Asia, primarily China.<ref name=stores>[http://www.pacificcoffee.com/eng/store/fulllist.php List of Pacific Coffee Company locations (in English)]</ref>

USA]]|FR Yugoslavia}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIBA EuroBasket]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1995 EuroBasket|1995 Greece]]|FR Yugoslavia}} {{MedalBronze|[[1999 EuroBasket|1999 France]]|FR Yugoslavia}} }} '''Vlade Divac''' ({{lang-sr-cyr|Владе Дивац}}, {{IPA-sh|ʋlǎːde dǐːʋats|pron}}; born February 3, 1968) is a Serbian professional basketball executive and retired player, currently serving as the vice president of basketball operations and general manager of the [[Sacramento Kings]].<ref name="divac-gm"/>
Divac spent most of his career in the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). At {{nowrap|7 ft 1 in}}, he played [[center (basketball)|center]] and was known for his passing skills. He was among the first group of European basketball players to transfer to the NBA in the late 1980s and was named one of the [[50 Greatest EuroLeague Contributors]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euroleague.net/item/24016 |title=Experts decide European Club Basketball's 50 greatest contributors – 50 YEARS – Welcome to EUROLEAGUE BASKETBALL |publisher=Euroleague.net |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> He is one of seven players in NBA history to record 13,000 [[Point (basketball)|points]], 9,000 [[Rebound (basketball)|rebounds]], 3,000 [[Assist (basketball)|assists]] and 1,500 blocked shots, along with [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]], [[Tim Duncan]], [[Shaquille O'Neal]], [[Kevin Garnett]], [[Pau Gasol]], and [[Hakeem Olajuwon]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/lakers/news/divac_retires_051018.html |title=Vlade Divac Announces Retirement; Accepts Position With Lakers &#124|publisher=Nba.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref><ref group=n>The NBA did not record blocked shots before the 1973–74 season, so earlier players such as [[Bill Russell]] and [[Wilt Chamberlain]] probably had similar career achievements.</ref> Divac was also the first player born and trained outside the United States to play in over 1,000 games in the NBA. On August 20, 2010, he was inducted into the [[FIBA Hall of Fame]] in recognition of his play in international competition.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.halloffame.fiba.com/pages/eng/hof/news/p/newsid/42798/arti.html |title=FIBA announces 2010 Hall of Fame Class |publisher=[[FIBA]] |date=2010-08-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101019073536/http://www.halloffame.fiba.com/pages/eng/hof/news/p/newsid/42798/arti.html |archivedate=2010-10-19 |df= }}</ref>
Aside from being noticed for his basketball abilities, Divac is also known as a humanitarian, helping children in his native country of Serbia, and in Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/news/divac_youcantoo_070922.html |title=Divac Creates New Team With "You Can Too" Campaign |publisher=NBA.com |date=2007-09-22 |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> In October 2008, he was appointed as government adviser in Serbia for humanitarian issues.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/nba/news?slug=ap-divac-serbianadviser&prov=ap&type=lgns |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-10-17 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081020220122/http://sports.yahoo.com/nba/news?slug=ap-divac-serbianadviser&prov=ap&type=lgns |archivedate=October 20, 2008 |df= }}</ref> In February 2009, he was elected President of the [[Serbian Olympic Committee]] for a 4-year term <ref name="blicokserb">{{cite web |url=http://www.blic.rs/sport.php?id=80659 |title=Divac na čelu OKS naredne četiri godine |language=Serbian |date=2009-02-24 |publisher=Blic |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090227115052/http://www.blic.rs/sport.php?id=80659 |archivedate=2009-02-27 |df= }}</ref> and re-elected in November 2012.<ref name=oks>{{cite web|url=http://sport.blic.rs/Ostali-sportovi/223132/Divac-ponovo-izabran-za-predsednika-Olimpijskog-komiteta-Srbije |title=Vlade Divac ponovo izabran za predsednika Olimpijskog komiteta |language=Serbian |trans-title=Vlade Divac re-elected for the President of the Olympic Committee|publisher=Beta |date= November 7, 2012}}</ref> In 2013, Divac received an honor from the World Sports Humanitarian Hall of Fame.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/kings/news/divac_hall_of_fame08.html |title=Kings News Full | The Official Site Of The Sacramento Kings |publisher=Nba.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref>
==Club playing career== Divac began playing basketball in his home town [[Prijepolje]] for the team KK Elan. He began his professional career in Yugoslavia playing for [[KK Sloga|Sloga]] from [[Kraljevo]], and was immediately noted for scoring 27 points against [[KK Crvena zvezda|Crvena zvezda]].<ref name="vreme">{{cite web |url=http://www.vreme.com/cms/view.php?id=512456 |title=Srbin broj jedan van Srbije |publisher=[[Vreme]] |date=2007-09-20 |author=Slobodan Georgijev |language=Serbian}}</ref>
===KK Partizan=== In the summer of 1986, Divac was the top star of the basketball transfer season, and he ended up signing with [[KK Partizan|Partizan]] for [[Deutsche Mark|DM]]14,000.<ref name="vreme" />
In the [[1986–87 Yugoslav First Basketball League|1986–87 Yugoslav First League season]], with players like Divac, [[Aleksandar Đorđević]], [[Žarko Paspalj]], [[Željko Obradović]], and with [[head coach|coach]] [[Duško Vujošević]] at the helm, Partizan had a "dream team", which won the [[Yugoslavian First Federal Basketball League|Yugoslavian League]] title. In the subsequent [[1987–88 FIBA European Champions Cup|1987–88 FIBA European Champions Cup season]] (now called EuroLeague), the club failed to reach the top of the [[EuroLeague]], after having lost to [[Maccabi Tel Aviv B.C.|Maccabi Tel Aviv]] in [[1988 EuroLeague Final Four|the semifinal in Ghent]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stat.co.rs/partizan/eng/istorijat.php |title=Istorija: Novi "Dream Team" |publisher=[[KK Partizan|Partizan]] official website |accessdate=2007-09-24}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> [[KK Split|Jugoplastika]], with [[Dino Rađa]] and [[Toni Kukoč]], was a stronger team in the subsequent three years, reigning both in Yugoslavia and in Europe.
Divac had an unusual style compared to most other [[center (basketball)|centers]] of his generation: despite his height, he possessed good mobility, had good control of the ball, and was a decent shooter. On occasion, he would also act as a [[point guard|play maker]]. His trademark moves included a mid-range shot at the top of the key and flip shots around the rim, while facing the complete opposite direction. His quirky moves complemented how he liked playing gags on the court: in the [[1989 EuroBasket]], he lifted teammate [[Zoran Radović]] for a [[slam dunk]]. In just four professional seasons in Europe, he became the most sought-after big man on the continent, after [[Arvydas Sabonis]].<ref name="vreme" />
===Los Angeles Lakers=== Drafted into the NBA in [[1989 NBA draft|1989]] by the [[Los Angeles Lakers]], Divac became one of the first European players to have an impact in the league. Under the mentorship of [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] and [[Magic Johnson]], he improved his play and adapted to the American style of basketball. Though he spoke no English, he quickly became popular among his teammates and the public for his charm and joviality. In the 1989–90 season, he was selected into the [[NBA All-Rookie Team]].<ref name="vreme" />
Divac earned a reputation for [[flop (basketball)|flopping]], or deceiving the officials into calling a foul on the other team by purposely falling to the floor upon contact with an opposing player.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/sports/columnists/orl-nbainsider2807jan28,0,6686181.column?track=rss |title=Shutting down acting school? |author=Tim Povtak |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=2007-01-28 |accessdate=2007-04-29}}</ref> Veteran NBA forward [[P. J. Brown]] claimed that Divac might have been the best of all time at flopping.<ref>[http://www.azcentral.com/sports/suns/articles/0318nbaflop0318.html Flopping keeps cropping up], by Doug Haller, ''The Arizona Republic'', published March 18, 2007, retrieved April 29, 2007</ref> Divac freely admitted doing so, adding that he usually did it when he felt like the officials had missed some calls and owed him.<ref>[http://www.thefreelibrary.com/BEST+ACTOR:+DIVAC+IN+%60FLOP+WARS+II'-a086219289 BEST ACTOR: DIVAC IN `FLOP WARS II'], by Kevin Modesti, Los Angeles ''Daily News'', published May 22, 2002</ref> However, when the NBA instituted anti-flopping penalties in 2012, Divac expressed his support for such rules, stating that he felt players after him were "overdo[ing] it" with respect to flopping.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nba/kings/2015/03/10/vlade-divac-sacramento-front-office-vivek-ranadive-flopping-lakers-kobe-bryant/24666243/|title=Even Vlade Divac thinks flopping has gotten out of hand|publisher=|accessdate=21 February 2017}}</ref> Ian Thomsen, a ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'' columnist, grouped Divac with fellow international players [[Anderson Varejão]] and [[Manu Ginóbili]] as the players who "made [flopping] famous", exaggerating contact on the court in a manner analogous to [[diving (football)|diving]] in [[FIFA]] games.<ref>{{cite web| url= http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2012/writers/ian_thomsen/09/28/nba-flopping-david-stern/ | title= NBA's new flopping policy the best response to a difficult problem | date= September 28, 2012 | first= Ian |last= Thomsen |work= [[Sports Illustrated]] | publisher= cnn.com| accessdate=2012-09-28| quote= The ugly trend of faking physical contact began in soccer, a sport in which gamesmanship has given way to players writhing in false agony around the world. Soccer has been unable to fix its problem, but now the NBA will have an opportunity to deter players from trying to simulate violent contact in ways made famous by Vlade Divac, Manu Ginobili and Anderson Varejao.}}</ref>
===Charlotte Hornets=== On July 1, 1996, Divac was traded to the [[Charlotte Hornets]] for the draft rights to [[Kobe Bryant]] and played two seasons there until signing with the Sacramento Kings in July 1998.
===Two games with KK Crvena zvezda=== During the [[1998–99 NBA lockout]], in January 1999, Divac played 2 games for Partizan's [[Eternal derby (Serbia)|eternal rival]] [[KK Crvena Zvezda]], in the [[1998–99 FIBA EuroLeague|1998–99 EuroLeague season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fibaeurope.com/cid_KNce8jInH7Qj1EsyH5rjn2.compID_,Uz02qBnJiADOq5VntEf53.roundID_2570.season_1999.teamID_1490.playerID_2626.html |title=profile |publisher=Fibaeurope.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref>
His debut for the ''crveno-beli'' took place mid-season, on [[Orthodox Christmas]], versus a heavily favoured [[BC Žalgiris|Žalgiris]] side led by [[Tyus Edney]], [[Mindaugas Žukauskas]], [[Saulius Štombergas]], and [[George Zidek|Jiří Zídek Jr.]]. Supported by a raucous home crowd and energized by Divac's arrival, as well as his 16 points and 8 rebounds, Crvena zvezda pulled off a 77-69 memorable upset win.<ref name="mondo-feb-2015">{{cite news|url=http://mondo.rs/a767526/Sport/Kosarka/Zvezda-Zalgiris-secanje-na-debi-Vlade-Divca.html|title=Prošli put protiv Žalgirisa za Zvezdu je igrao...|agency=mondo.rs|date=4 February 2015|accessdate=4 February 2015}}</ref>
Divac's brief stint with Crvena zvezda, for which he reportedly got paid US$250,000 per game,<ref name="mondo-feb-2015"/> immediately became a sore point with KK Partizan fans, who unfurled a banner calling him a traitor, at their club's next game.<ref name="mondo-feb-2015"/>
The issue of playing for the hated cross-town rival reignited several years later, when Divac returned to KK Partizan as club president. At the time, he stated his decision to play for Crvena zvezda was "a mistake".<ref name="mondo-feb-2015"/>
===Sacramento Kings=== He then signed as a [[free agent]] with the [[Sacramento Kings]] where he played for six seasons alongside fellow countryman [[Peja Stojaković]]. Teamed with Stojaković, [[Hedo Türkoğlu]], [[Chris Webber]] and [[Mike Bibby]]; Divac revitalized the [[Sacramento Kings]] franchise. The Kings rose in the NBA ranks, becoming a perennial playoff contender and eventually a championship contender, leading the league in wins in [[2001–02 NBA season|2001–02]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/nba/standings?season=2002&group=league&seasontype=2&standType=standings |title=NBA Standings – 2001–2002 |publisher=Sports.espn.go.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> The Kings, however, could not get past the [[Los Angeles Lakers]], who beat them in a [[2002 NBA Playoffs#Conference Finals|7-game series in 2002.]] <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/basketball/ex-referee-tim-donaghy-blows-whistle-nba-dirty-secrets-article-1.293192|title=Ex-referee Tim Donaghy blows whistle on NBA dirty secrets|publisher=|accessdate=21 February 2017}}</ref>
===Return to the Lakers=== After the [[2003–04 NBA season]], Divac became a [[free agent]]. He signed a deal to return to the Lakers, part of [[Mitch Kupchak]]'s plan to overhaul Laker basketball. The Lakers, following a defeat in the NBA Finals, had traded away or released most of their players, including [[Shaquille O'Neal]], [[Gary Payton]], [[Karl Malone]], [[Derek Fisher]], and more; Divac was supposed to help fill that void.
However, Divac suffered back problems and could not play most of the season, and even when he returned, could only play about nine minutes per game, averaging 2.3 points per game and 2.1 rebounds per game in 15 games, he played 8 games early in the season and 7 more in the final month of the season.
On 14 July 2005, 37-year-old Divac announced his retirement, ending his sixteen-year NBA and twenty-two-year professional basketball career.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/lakers/news/divac_retires_051018.html|title=Vlade Divac Announces Retirement; Accepts Position With Lakers - THE OFFICIAL SITE OF THE LOS ANGELES LAKERS|publisher=|accessdate=21 February 2017}}</ref> Divac accepted a position with the Lakers as a European liaison to help with scouting overseas.
===Retirement=== The Kings retired his No. 21 jersey in a ceremony on March 31, 2009.<ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090401/ap_on_sp_bk_ne/bkn_kings_divac_honored;_ylt=An5HUchghgZmP09wgS_FjaILMxIF Kings retire Divac's No. 21 Jersey]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Yahoo! Sports, March 31, 2009</ref> Over his 16 years in the NBA, Divac earned over $93,000,000 in salary.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.basketball-reference.com/players/d/divacvl01.html |title=Vlade Divac NBA & ABA Stats |publisher=Basketball-Reference.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-24}}</ref> In September 2009, he played for the "NBA Generations" team in the 2009 NBA Asia Challenge, a series of exhibitions against [[Korean Basketball League]] and [[Philippine Basketball Association]] players.<ref>{{cite web|title=NBA Asia Challenge 2009|url=http://www.nba.com/asiachallenge2009/|website=NBA.com|accessdate=21 April 2015}}</ref>
==National team== [[File:Vlade Divac & Drazen Petrovic in Argentina 1990.jpg|thumb|right|170px|Divac with [[Dražen Petrović]] in the [[1990 FIBA World Championship]] held in Argentina.]]
In summer 1986, at 18, right after signing for KK Partizan, Divac debuted for the senior [[Yugoslavia national basketball team]] at the [[1986 FIBA World Championship]] in Madrid, on invitation by the head coach [[Krešimir Ćosić]]. However, the excellent rookie's performance was spoiled by the event in the semi-finals against the [[Soviet Union national basketball team|Soviet Union]]. Forty-five seconds before the end, Yugoslavia had a comfortable lead of 9 points, but the Soviets scored two three-pointers within a few seconds and cut the difference to 3 points. Yugoslavia tried to hold the ball for the remaining time, opting to continue the play with throw-ins instead of free throws following fouls, but with only 14 seconds left, Divac committed a [[double dribble]], the Soviets were awarded the ball, and tied the score with another three-pointer. In the overtime, the Soviets easily prevailed against the shocked Yugoslavs, who had to be content with the bronze.<ref name="vreme" />
The next year, Divac participated in the team that took the gold at the FIBA Junior World Championship (since split into separate [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship|under-19]] and [[FIBA Under-21 World Championship|under-21]] events) in [[Bormio]], Italy. That event launched the young generation of Yugoslavian basket ballers, also featuring stars like Rađa and Kukoč, regarded as likely the best in history. Before the [[breakup of Yugoslavia]], they would also take the titles at [[EuroBasket 1989]] and the [[1990 FIBA World Championship]] in [[Argentina]],<ref name="vreme" /> where they were led by [[Dražen Petrović]],<ref name="fiba1989">{{cite web |url=http://www.fibaeurope.com/cid_KNce8jInH7Qj1EsyH5rjn2.teamID_390.compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_1989.roundID_938.html |title=Eurobasket 1989 |publisher=[[FIBA]]}}</ref> as well as the [[EuroBasket 1991]] title, with [[Aleksandar Đorđević]] at [[point guard]].<ref name="fiba1991">{{cite web | url=http://www.fibaeurope.com/cid_KNce8jInH7Qj1EsyH5rjn2.teamID_390.compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_1991.roundID_2263.html |title=Eurobasket 1991 |publisher=[[FIBA]]}}</ref>
[[File:Yugoslavia 1990 basketball.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Divac (fourth from right, at centre) with the [[Yugoslavia national basketball team|Yugoslavia team]] that won the [[EuroBasket 1989]].]] When Yugoslavia won the gold in the [[1990 FIBA World Championship]], fans rushed onto the court. One of them was holding a [[Croatia]]n flag, one of the six republics that made up Yugoslavia. Divac claims that he told the man that he should not be waving that flag, since this was a win for Yugoslavia. Divac claims the man made a derogatory remark about the Yugoslav flag, at which point Divac took his flag from him. This happened during a very tense time where nationalistic pride was threatening to tear Yugoslavia apart and ignite a war. The taking of the flag made Divac a hero to Serbs, and a villain to Croatians. Divac has stated that he did not mean it as an act against Croatia and he would have taken away a Serbian flag if a Serb fan had done the same.<ref name=once>{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/once-brothers,46215/| title=Once Brothers |publisher=A. V. club |author=Scott Tobias |date=2010-10-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2010/oct/12/entertainment/la-et-vlade-divac-20101012 |title=Television review: Vlade Divac searches for closure in ESPN's 'Once Brothers' |publisher=LA Times |author=John Scheibe |date=2010-12-10}}</ref>
This action, along with the [[Yugoslav Wars]], alienated Divac from many of his former Croatian friends, particularly [[Dražen Petrović]], whom he considered his best friend.<ref name=once/> When Yugoslavia won [[EuroBasket 1995]], and [[Croatia national basketball team|Croatia]] won bronze, Croatia, still at [[War in Croatia|war with Serbs from Croatia]], walked off the podium during the medal ceremony. The teams had not faced each other in the tournament.
